person.persName: Lazarus Whitehead Powell (Henderson attorney and politician)

body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Graduated from the St. Joseph College in 1833 and studied law at Transylvania University. Admitted to the bar in 1835 and practiced law in Henderson, Kentucky. Married to Harriet Anne Jennings Powell. Father of James Henry Powell, John Rowan Powell, Anne Powell, Charles J. Powell, and Richard Powell. Owned fifty-six enslaved persons in 1860. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1836. Elected as a Democratic Party presidential elector in 1844. Elected and served as governor of Kentucky from 1851 to 1855. Served the Commonwealth of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States Senate from 1859 to 1865.
